column5: The Niagara aside, this time of year it's tough to predict where and when to catch steelhead. Sunday saw seemingly perfect conditions: a dropping and clearing river after a huge blowout combined with warmer temps and light rain for most of the day. These conditions a month ago would have seen huge numbers of fish caught. Sunday I worked hard for just a handful of fish... That's the way it goes and frankly I wouldn't want it any other way. After doing this for 30 years I still havn't figured these fish out but that's what makes the sport interesting and the great days all the more treasured. It's always a bonus when you can get out this time of year, not freeze your digits off and catch a few fish! There were fish being caught somewhat consistently though...and for those that're interested the top bait seemed to be.....live minnows.              Looks like there might be some decent conditions to be had on Thursday this week...   Cheers,  Mike

Tough time of year for sure solo....  I was out Saturday to freeze my guides a little, saw a couple of fish, one hookup and that was it for the day.  No complaints, I'm always happy to get out there regardless of fish caught or not!
Great report and pics Mike  Real nice looking steelies    Congratulations  Thanks for sharing Leechman
Mike, repairs to the car are finished   I am starting to get the itch!
Some great looking fish/pics there Mike.  Live minnows?  Are you a walleye guy at heart? hahahaha.
PUT A PILLOW UNDERNEATH THAT REEL!!!  OH THE HUMANITY!!!  Great report and pics Mike  Love the colouring on the first two.
They're made to be fished, not babied LOL!
Awe man, now everybody knows!!  nice outing Mike!

I loved that pillow !! I still have hope's of running into it washed up on the banks of that trib ... We will meet again  Mike , c'mon I was expecting atleast one pic showing off the shinny new minnow dispenser
It ain't broked in until it's been stomped into the mud a time or two!!!

awsome report, quick question though, you ever get skunked? even your shortest reports ("bad day" how you call them), which are still fun to read and browse through pictures, look better than most reports from the rest OFC members when they have good days on water. thanks for sharing.  btw, keep the fishing forecasts coming in the future as well.
THATS ONE DARK FISH  LOL AND LOOK AT THAT NO SHOPPING CARTS OR A PERSON TO BE SEEN!!! YA MUST OWN THAT PART OF THE RIVER .LOL NICE JOB BRO TUFF CONS INDEED OUT THERE STILL

Lookin good Mike.  Me, Dave and his buddy beat the crap out of the east on sunday, worked REAL hard and tossed everything in the books into perfect water conditions with ZIPPO to show for it. Well two tiny buggers and a beauty hen that was lost.  and an IMX that was almost snapped like a twig too, geez
I like this pic.  Nice one!

I can't believe he made it through that    .... The tip was bent under the ice shelf with the fish hauling arse down river ... I can't believe it didn't break     IMX  Mike, looking at this picture    the porting on that reel blows my mind !!!!!!
NICE, nothing better then steel at the mouth, sweet pics dude been doing that program for 3 weeks now the ole girls are geting dark already, sweet pics ........Keep up the goood work
Bows 793, 794 and 795 of 2008. lol.
WTG That's a beauty shot (tripper?) Great reel too Aniiversary Edition Angling Specs?  Jose
